meanings.definition: The act of transferring ownership or control of a business, enterprise, or service from the public sector to the private sector.
meanings.sent1: The privatizations of state-owned companies led to increased efficiency.
meanings.sent2: Many countries have seen successful privatizations of their national airlines.
meanings.sent3: The privatizations of the city's parking lots made finding a spot even harder!
meanings.sent4: Her approach to life was like a series of privatizations, always seeking independence.
meanings.sent5: The privatizations of the internet service providers brought about better customer service.

meanings.definition: The process of selling off state-owned assets to private investors.
meanings.sent1: Successful privatizations can attract foreign investment.
meanings.sent2: The privatizations of the telecommunications industry were met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent3: The privatizations of the old government buildings turned them into luxury hotels!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a privatizations of her dreams, turning them into reality.
meanings.sent5: The privatizations of the energy sector resulted in lower prices for consumers.

meanings.definition: The action of making something privately owned or controlled.
meanings.sent1: The privatizations of the healthcare system improved services for patients.
meanings.sent2: Government privatizations can sometimes lead to job losses.
meanings.sent3: The privatizations of the local farms made fresh produce more expensive.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was a privatizations of her imagination, creating beautiful art.
meanings.sent5: The privatizations of the transportation network enhanced efficiency and reduced costs.
